text:
John F. Kennedy Jr. was killed 25 years ago Tuesday when the plane he was piloting crashed into the ocean off the coast of Martha's Vineyard.

JFK Jr. took off from Fairfield, New Jersey, with his wife, Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy, and her older sister Lauren Bessette the evening of Friday, July 16, 1999.

Kennedy's plane was reported overdue early the next morning, as NBC 10's Paul McGonagle reported.



Kennedy and his wife were flying to Cape Cod to attend a Kennedy family wedding. They were going to stop at the Vineyard, which was Lauren Bessette's destination.



Searchers began to fear the worst when luggage and parts of a plane were discovered in the water.



The bodies of Kennedy and the Bessette sisters were recovered a few days later.

Investigators said Kennedy apparently became disoriented flying at night and in hazy weather conditions.
